result.execSummary:
The defendant Randy R Desjardins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Victim/Use or Attempt Force [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.45(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Plus Supervision Fees.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due and all available enforcement actions may be used to collect the debt.  You must  keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.

No contact with Charles Ramsey or his Family
Will pay restitution if determined by DOC

01:02 PM Defendant Randy R Desjardins in court, in custody.  Lester H Liptak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Randy R Desjardins appeared by video means.  State calls the case. DE has filed a MO for sentence modification due to COVID 19.  DE states he has 9 month left, has completed all his classes, asking that his remaining 9 months be served on extended supervision due to Covid.  State responds.  State opposes any modification of sentence at this time.  Mr Desjardins responds to the States argument.  Court will give an oral decision.  Oral ruling scheduled for July 28, 2020 at 11:15 am.

records.addlTxt: 10:32 AM Defendant Randy R Desjardins #00534066 in court, in custody.  Lester Liptak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 14CF19, 17CF36.  DE appears telephonic from Stanley Correctional Institute.  DE requesting modification on JOC.  DE wrote a letter to the court concerning DE being allowed to attend ERP programming.  DE states that he is not eligible for ERP progamming due to the violent nature of his offenses.  DE states he has been doing everything he can possibly do while incarcerated.  The State previously addressed DE's letter, believes sentence given was appropriate, does not believe there are any new factors as DE is stating.  The court will deny the motion for reconsideration.
